title: Unable to set Ringtone using My Sounds
content:
I've encountered what I can only think of must be a bug.

So when I first started using my new phone, I could set up custom ringtones with ease using the Sound settings and adding ringtones to 'My Sounds'. However, I downloaded a custom ringtone maker and edited a track to create my own ringtone, and used the ringtone maker to set it as my default ringtone.

I deleted the ringtone maker after some time, which has essentially locked my phone from using any other ringtone than a generic one (labelled 554). I can't set it as any built in track, nor a custom.

Reinstalling that ringtone maker allows me to use it to set my ringtones. It appears to be the only way I can set a ringtone now.

I am not sure how to remove that app so that I can go back to using the built in Sounds settings app.
category: Setting up and Personalizing your Device, Google Pixel 4 XL
